creditline: The Ulrich Acquisition Fund and The Driscoll Art Accessions Endowment Fund
life_date: North America, Great Lakes or Great Plains region
text: The Nehiiyawak are one of the most northern Plains tribes, occupying portions of Canada. Because they were numerous and inhabited a vast territory, their spot-stitch style of beadwork and decorative patterns, influenced neighboring tribes such as the Pikuni and A'aninin.
title: Pair of Moccasins
